Nursing Department Wins State Grant for Recruiting, Sep 19
paragraphs: Our award-winning department offers you one of the most dynamic nursing programs in Texas.

Here, you will learn from talented professors with real-world experience as you develop the knowledge and skills you need to succeed as a registered nurse (RN), move on to graduate school or become an advanced practice nurse (APRN).
Family Nurse Practitioner CertificateOur online Family Nurse Practitioner Certificate will develop your expertise as an Advanced Practice Registered Nurse. Accredited by CCNE.
Nurse Educator CertificateThe online Nurse Educator Certificate prepares you to teach future nurses at all educational levels and in healthcare settings. Accredited by CCNE.

The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master’s degree program in nursing and the postgraduate A.P.R.N. certificate program at Angelo State University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (https://www.aacnnursing.org/CCNE).
In addition, all nursing programs have full approval status by the Texas Board of Nursing.
Texas Board of Nursing1801 Congress Avenue, Ste. 10-200Austin, TX 78701Telephone: 512-305-7400Fax: 512-305-7401https://www.bon.texas.gov/
Jun 13
Jan 10
Sep 19

Healthcare is one of the largest and most diverse career fields in the world. Your ASU degree is your ticket to join this exciting industry and work as a nurse in virtually any healthcare setting. And, there are plenty of high-paying jobs waiting for you once you graduate.
Take a look at some other aspects of our department that make ASU an outstanding place to study nursing.

Practice your clinical skills on life-like mannequins that can mimic human symptoms, and utilize the dynamic BodyViz software in our computer lab for even more interactive learning. You can gain additional hands-on experience by participating in our Campus Clinics.
You can join our Student Nurses Association for professional development and networking opportunities, and to connect with your fellow students, professors and local healthcare professionals.
When you earn your B.S.N. degree, you will be prepared to take the NCLEX-RN exam to get your nursing license – and our students have a pass rate over 92%!

Master of Science in Nursing (M.S.N.) - Nurse Educator

“There is more one-on-one with your professors. I was able to succeed in most of my classes because I was able to talk to my professors.”

Marcus Jasso, Class of 2024, Nursing

“My favorite class was Anatomy my freshman year. This was my first glimpse into what my future would look like. That class created an experience that allowed me to discover my strengths and weakness and work on becoming a successful student.”

Alexis Samora, Class of 2022, Nursing

“The nursing department has a really nice facility. You can practice procedures on many of the manikins. In the simulation lab, they throw you into a scenario and teach you what you would need to do for the patient in that scenario.”

Marcus Jasso, Class of 2024, Nursing

“Angelo State is helping me with my job for the rest of my life. I don’t get to redo this, so I’m glad I chose Angelo State.”

Marcus Jasso, Class of 2024, Nursing
